Senior Graphics Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Graphics/Game Developer
Industry: Augmented Reality, Computer Software, Virtual Reality
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Imajion Co | No office location

Technologies

directx
uwp
c++
hlsl
fbx

Job description

Live anywhere, work remotely with Imajion to develop industry-leading communications solutions for the Architecture, Engineering and Construction sector leveraging Mixed Reality technology such as the HoloLens. Come help us build the first digital teleportation tool for AEC and make your mark in the communications technology landscape with mixed reality. Travel to Barcelona, Los Angeles, Munich, or Zadar during our collaborative development retreats designed to help fuel inspiration, wonder and fun because we want your work to feel like play.

Responsibilities:

  • Integration, adaptation, and extension of a Real Time Mixed Reality 3D rendering pipeline.
  • Development of UWP C++ 3D Rendering Components that interface with a Managed coded layer. 
  • Development of related 3D service components such as 3D model loaders, specifically FBX and BIM.

Requirements:

  • Intimate familiarity with Real Time 3D Rendering/Compositing, Particle Systems, HLSL Shaders/Effects.
  • You know how to write or modify DirectX rendering engines.
  • You know how to build components that interface with managed code.

You can point to a portfolio of work that clearly demonstrates your capabilities.

Apply now

  • 401k
  • health insurance
  • work remotely
  • family time off

items.content:
XD Designer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: eLearning, Events
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private
Company: O'Reilly Media | No office location

Technologies

user-experience
user-interface
design
adobe

Job description

About the Role

Reporting to the Lead Experience Designer, the Experience Designer (XD) collaborates with members of the Product, Engineering, and Creative teams to imagine and build user-centric learning experiences delivered via our online learning platform. Using a solve, learn, teach model, the platform helps individuals and teams find answers to in-the-moment technology challenges, develop deep expertise in hundreds of today's business and technology topics, and become highly-engaged life-long learners. The XD has a strong impact on how our millions of customers interact with learning experiences on our SaaS platform. The individual in this role will work as a team member in an agile squad supporting strategic projects. Candidates will apply design principles to assist various teams in producing clear and compelling visual communications.

About the O'Reilly Experience Design (XD) Creative Team

We are a hybrid (design and code) in-house agency, working on strategic XD projects across our online platform. We create user experiences that support and encourage learning for individuals and teams, across media, in alignment with the O'Reilly brand and our user’s desires.

In addition to XD product roadmap-driven sprints and ongoing day-to-day design support, we also collaborate with O'Reilly's marketing and creative teams. At its core, our creative team is focused on the delicate balance of ideas, aesthetics, messages, form, function—and brand. Because the best design is that which has a positive influence on the lives of our customers, we put understanding their needs and desires at the heart of everything we do.

About You

 As a Designer You Have:

  • 5+ years of professional visual XD/UX experience designing large-scale (SaaS and/or ecommerce preferred) responsive products, high-content properties, and mobile applications for brands and/or media.
  • An analytical and visual mind, with a hunger for learning and a desire to solve complex human problems with technology.
  • Strong ability to refine designs through sketches, diagrams, wireframes, visual designs and interactive pieces.
  • A desire to challenge yourself both personally and professionally; as well as staying current with technology and interaction design trends.
  • Can-do attitude: accepts difficult challenges with curiosity, creativity, and dedication to craft. 

Role Responsibilities

Leverage core experience design and atomic design principles to weave iconography, typography, color, space, and texture together online to create an unparalleled learning experience on the O'Reilly platform.

  • Participate in user research and discovery on complex problems; speak with customers, get to know the problem space through research and iteration.
  • Design interfaces (and thus experiences) that inspire, engage, inform, and excite our customers.
  • Apply graphic and user-centered design principles to produce high-quality visuals—from concept to component-driven comps.
  • Collaborate with designers and creative team(s) across the company to continuously refine and center the O’Reilly design language, and create innovative, branded designs that people love viewing, using, and sharing with others.
  • Advocate for the user. Our users inform where we are going. Our teams focus on listening to users, and letting their needs guide us to the best solutions. It’s important for us to know we are solving for real people.
  • Take full ownership of your work, and take responsibility for every last detail, every step of the way.
  • Ability and willingness to communicate clearly with various stakeholders
  • Contribute to the evolution of the company's visual and experience style guide—including recommending data-inspired improvements and codifying usage rules on an ongoing basis.
  • Help build an exceptional XD team.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional visual XD/UX design experience—preferably creating online learning related products
  • Online portfolio of work, demonstrating experience leading or managing the design of complex systems across multiple platforms, including mobile and touch-based interfaces.
  • Strong understanding of responsive design and web technologies.
  • Strong conceptualization and visual communication ability.
  • Exceptional design skills, production value and attention to detail.
  • Ability to create wireframes as well as visual design comps.
  • Expert knowledge of Sketch, Adobe CC Suite and associated design tools. Familiarity with HTML, CSS and JavaScript would also be helpful.
  • Proficient with user interface design patterns and standard user-centered design methodologies.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Understanding of common software product management practices.
  • Understanding of common software development practices.
  • Experience with inclusive and accessible design preferred.
Apply now

About O'Reilly Media

Inspiring the future for more than 40 years

We share the knowledge and teach the skills people need to change their world. For more than 40 years, O’Reilly has imparted the world-shaping ideas of innovators through books, articles, conferences, and our online learning platform.

When individuals, teams, and entire enterprises connect with the world's leading experts and content providers, anything is possible. Whether you're working to advance your career, be a better manager, or achieve the next breakthrough in technology or business, learning new skills is at the heart of it all.

With a range of formats including live online training courses, interactive tutorials, books, videos, and case studies, we equip all members of the workforce with the insight they need to stay ahead in an ever-changing economy.

Learning should not be measured in terms of usage, course completion, or certifications. Learning should be measured in terms of outcomes. We want to prepare people to solve challenging problems and inspire them with what’s possible for the future.  

Something we’ve been doing for over 40 years.

Benefits

  • Medical, dental, vision insurance
  • Domestic partner coverage
  • Short and long-term disability insurance
  • Matching 401(k) plan
  • Paid time off for your birthday
  • Parental leave
  • Flexible sick time
  • Free O'Reilly books and subscription to learning platform
  • Flexible spending accounts

Job description

Technical Coach (Design) 
 Remote · Part Time or Full Time


Founded in 2012, Bloc was the first online coding bootcamp. Today, Bloc offers aspiring career-changers programs in software development and design. Bloc offers you an opportunity to join a tight-knit team pursuing a worthy goal: the training, guidance, and support of those who are working towards to new careers as developers and designers. Job Description 
Bloc’s mission is to help individuals pursue their craft and improve their lives. As a Technical Coach at Bloc, you will directly help students develop mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers by helping them solve their day-to-day problems and questions. Responsibilities

  • Respond to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team
  • Adhere to the established Service-Level Agreement to ensure students are receiving responses in the defined timely manner
  • Maintain the required quality in assisting students with technical questions and guidance
  • Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 
  • Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team
  • Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values
  • As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members
  • As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc

Requirements

  • Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully
  • Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Patient and empathetic
  • High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 
  • Must thrive working autonomously 
  • Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers
  • Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection
  • Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)
  • Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin



Terms of Employment

  • This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest.
  • Remote .
  • Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.
  • Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits.
Apply now

About Thinkful Inc.

Thinkful is a new type of school that brings high-growth tech careers to ambitious people everywhere. The company provides 1-on-1 learning through its network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education. Thinkful offers programs in web development and data science, with in-person communities in up-and-coming tech hubs around the U.S. To join the Thinkful network visit thinkful.com.

Benefits

  • Join team of 300 developers mentoring the developers of the future
  • Access to top rated curriculum
  • Paid position
  • Flexible Schedule and Hours

items.content:
HTML5 / Web Designer (React/Redux Pref.)

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Big Data, Developer APIs, Sports betting odds algorithms
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Core Data | No office location

Technologies

reactjs
user-interface
html

Job description

This position is for a quick turnaround project for a highly skilled individual. If that's you and you have a portfolio to back that up, feel free to quote your hourly or project rate upfront.

Core Data currently needs an additional HTML5 web designer with react and redux experience to create a major expansion on the company's HTML5-based UI. The existing UI can be seen at this link. The existing UI is focused on displaying available offers for live (actively in play) sports games and uses a simplified navigation scheme where the user simply selects a sport, then a game, and ultimately selects what wagers are wanted.

The candidate will need to expand this User Interface to include "prematch" betting. Mockup designs for this have already been prepared here. The enhancement will keep all existing functionality of the live UI, but add a tab/screen for upcoming games that have not yet started. The list of available prematch games is numerous (sometimes in the thousands) and so the navigation scheme will be much more sophisticated than the live (current) navigation scheme. The company's goal is to have a clean, smooth, and intuitive cross-browser product.

The candidate will be expected to combine their knowledge of aesthetics and intuitive UX principles to create a cutting-edge, crisp, and attractive prematch expansion to the company's UI. The existing UI uses React.JS and Redux, so prior experience with these frameworks is necessary. The backend data to power the UI is provided vi a WebSockets feed and our backend team can make reasonable changes to the feed format if it is necessary to facilitate a speedy project completion.

Apply now

About Core Data

First and foremost, we are a software development company owned and operated entirely by professionals with a strong technical background.  Since technology is our core focus and software is our principal product, all projects at CDS are important and recognized by the highest levels of management.

We believe in hiring the best candidates for every position.  It is for this reason that we do not restrict ourselves to arbitrary geographical locations.  Most of our staff works on a remote basis.  Our hiring decisions are based on one's abilities, not location.

The projects we take on run the gamut.  Primarily we are a data and statistics provider with an emphasis on low-latency, real-time data feeds. 

Benefits

  • Monthly paid time off
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Flexible hours / work schedules

items.content:
*Company Description*

This a great chance to join a hugely exciting small business based in Edinburgh and have a direct influence on where our product and company are headed. From day one, you will be a critical member of our growing team. We are hugely passionate about the business we have built, and we are very excited about the projects we have lined up, which will open doors to lots of exciting global opportunities.

We’re growing fast, and shipping software just as fast - you will need to be able to execute efficiently and swiftly. If you’re passionate about creating user-friendly interfaces, we’d love to meet you.

*Job Description*
We are looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer who possesses a real passion for understanding the world of our users, generating insights and designing solutions that empower them to accomplish tasks through our product.

Our products include responsive web applications, search engines, APIs, machine learning, online payments, image recognition and native apps.

Responsibilities

* Produce designs for new and existing features and products through wireframes, visual comps, prototypes, and design specifications.
* Participate in product ideation and concept development using an iterative, user-centered design process.
* Articulate how a design solution fits into an overall narrative and addresses an unmet user or business need.
* Define holistic solutions and understand system-level implications of design decisions.
* Develop high-level concepts that consider the user, business, technology constraints, and insights gathered through research and testing.
* Validate and improve designs using both qualitative and quantitative methods, through close collaboration with development and product managers.
* Uphold product quality by ensuring that design solutions are implemented as intended, through close collaboration with product and development teams.
* Help out with general marketing needs such as email design, animations, video.

*Qualifications*
* Familiarity working in Sketch, Zeplin, and Adobe Creative Suite
* Portfolio demonstrating knowledge of visual and user experience design
* Experience prototyping, wireframing, and vetting ideas with both users and internal stakeholders.
* Experience designing web-based software applications
* Understanding of Agile methodology
* Some knowledge of CSS and HTML is desirable
* Understanding of native iOS / Android design patterns is desirable

*Benefits*
* Competitive salary
* Opportunities for travelling and remote working
* Comprehensive benefits package and flexible working + work-life balance driven environment.
* Options pool
* Opportunity to work in our shared office with one of Scotland's most exciting tech companies (with free parking)
* Free drinks and coffee
* Opportunity to bring your pooch with you to work

items.content:
Senior UX Designer // Trifacta

Company: Trifacta

Tags:
  • UX
  • Data
  • enterprise

    • Senior UX Designer – Berlin

    Please include URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered.

    About Us

    At Trifacta, we’re designing a product for a growing group of users who have a very real pain. Cleaning and structuring data is both a crucial and difficult activity, a process that traditionally requires a huge amount of time and effort. We believe that transforming data shouldn’t be a painful problem and that user-centered design is particularly well suited to creating simple, intuitive, and enjoyable solutions. This is a lofty goal in a space that is traditionally deprived of usable products.

    As designers, we recognize, perhaps more than anybody else, the value of professional tools capable not only to accommodate our needs but also to empower and inspire us in our everyday work. Our mission (and our passion) is providing our users with these same great experiences. And our target users are tough ones: smart, skilled, incredibly task-driven data analysts with unique mental models. We are facing big challenges here: building modern data tools for a large variety of users and needs in a complex and incredibly dynamic context. How can we support them in the shift from spreadsheets to the complexity of big data? How can we give users the ability to understand the impact of their work across data, projects, and organizations?

    We are looking for a talented Senior UX Designer to help us tackling these hard challenges by working from the beginning to the end of product building, from generating new ideas to crafting detailed microinteractions. You will participate in the definition of a new generation of products capable of combining user inputs and machine learning technologies to accomplish complex tasks in simple, enjoyable ways. Come be part of an incredibly passionate, talented and diverse team in which collaboration and mutual respect are key.

    Responsibilities

    • You will articulate and convey designs via scenarios, sketches, storyboards and presentations, lo- and hi-fi mockups, detailed interaction specs, prototypes or animations.
    • You’ll drive your designs forward through every step of the design process and know what details matter at each stage: formative research, conceptual and interaction design, prototyping, and usability studies. Through this process we’d rather you show than tell.
    • You will work closely with PMs to discover and understand user needs and requirements. We hope you can help us defining what we should build, not just how to build it.
    • You will work closely with engineers to understand technical considerations and implement our designs down to the last detail.
    • You will contribute to the design, documentation and publishing of our design system.
    • Our company and processes are ever-changing, so we hope you can embrace and influence the change to make Trifacta a better place.

    Requirements

    • You have a minimum of 3 years of industry experience in product design with a proven track record of success. You can share several great examples of real work you’ve shipped, and what you learned along the way.
    • You’ve shipped enterprise products and you feel comfortable working with and for data, juggling technical constraints and gnarly details. You know how to work with and motivate engineers to get the fit and finish right.
    • You’re a generalist with a strong focus on UI and UX. You are passionate about building users interfaces and crafting beautiful and intuitive interactions leveraging the latest web technologies.
    • You have thorough knowledge and experience across a range of design approaches, methodologies and prototyping skills.
    • You obsess over details and are excited to polish until your work is pixel-perfect.
    • You have strong written & verbal communication and presentation skills. You are able to effectively structure and share your work in an international setup with 6+ hours of time difference, frequent asynchronous communications, remote design reviews, etc..
    • You are able to manage and work on multiple projects simultaneously.
    • Our team deeply values collaboration. You are passionate and committed to working with other designers and across disciplines to drive change into products. You’re confident, but willing to learn. We want to learn from you too!

    Benefits and Perks of working at Trifacta

    • You will work on an international, friendly team on one of the most exciting opportunities in the data space.
    • We will help you grow your skills through mentorships and education support. Our environment is focused on collaboration and learning
    • You will work from our brand-new offices in Berlin Mitte
    • We value work/life balance
    • We have monthly team events
    • You can visit our headquarters in San Francisco at least once a year
    • We offer relocation support
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Designer

Company: NEX
Headquarters: Vaduz, Liechtenstein
https://neonexchange.org
NEX is platform for cryptocurrency exchange that cares deeply about user centered design. These principles are largely missing from today’s decentralized platforms and exchanges, and we see it as our mission to design products that anyone can use and love. We are looking for an experience visual designer (remote) who wants to help take our products to the next level. You should have a solid understanding of design practices, typography, color and visual layout.

Responsibilities

  • Create beautiful marketing and social material for our channels.
  • Champion a brand book that encompasses Neon Exchange as a company.
  • Help out with larger projects when required.
  • Collaborate and work with the wider team as well as company stakeholders.

We are looking for:

  • 3-5 years experience in a professional design role in areas such as graphic, UI, web, app or brand identity (agency or startup experience is a bonus)
  • Strong typography, colour and layout knowledge.
  • An outstanding portfolio demonstrating work from concept to completion including at least web, app or and visual design projects.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • In-depth knowledge of using Sketch, Adobe CC (Photoshop/Illustrator) and Invision.

We prefer but don’t require:
  • Experience in the financial, technology, or e-commerce sector.
  • An understanding of HTML/CSS.
  • Formal BA degree in industrial, graphic, interaction or similar
  • Experience working in remote teams

UX Design Course Mentor (Part-Time/Flexible/Remote) at Springboard

San Francisco, Bengaluru, Remote · Contract

✔ We’re driven by a big mission. Education is broken and we’re helping fix it. If successful, we will bring high quality yet affordable education to millions of people around the world.
✔ Our team is phenomenal, and we look out for each other. We genuinely care about your personal/professional growth.
✔ You'll have immense responsibility. We’ll give you a big mandate + resources, and let you run with it. You won't be micromanaged.
✔ You'll work closely with the founders, and help set strategy and direction.

Applied
Apply to Springboard
Add a message to Springboard
Apply

Job Description

PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY VIA https://jobs.lever.co/springboard/54b2fbe2-7add-487f-bc71-2eccaf0d60f9?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=AngelList

The Opportunity
Springboard runs an online, self-paced UX Design workshop in which participants learn with the help of a curated curriculum and 1-1 guidance from an expert mentor. Our mentor community - the biggest strength of our programs - comprises some of the best experts in the field.

If you are as passionate about mentoring as you are about UX, and can give a few hours per week in return for an honorarium, we would love to hear from you.

Please reach out to us with any questions at mentors@springboard.com :-)

The Program
* Completely online
* Self-paced
* Students learn the fundamentals of UX with the help of a curated online curriculum and project-based deliverables
* Coursework is ~100 hours
* On average, students finish in 2-3 months
* Students are working professionals and college students from all over the world, interested in getting started with UX Design
* Students have a weekly 30-minute checkin with their mentor to discuss questions, projects, and career advice!

You:
* are as passionate about teaching design as about design itself
* are proficient in the topics covered in our UX Design (https://www.springboard.com/workshops/ux-design/)  workshop
* have at least 2 years of relevant work experience, and a handsome portfolio to show for it
* are available for weekly, 30-minute video check-ins with students to help them set and achieve learning goals, answer subject matter questions, provide feedback on projects, and offer career advice
* are empathetic and have excellent communication skills

Benefits:
* Membership in a rich community of expert mentors from great companies like AirBnB, Uber, and Pivotal
* Change the lives of students in our program
* Help us revolutionize online education!
* Receive a monthly per-student honorarium
* Work at your convenience

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY VIA https://jobs.lever.co/springboard/54b2fbe2-7add-487f-bc71-2eccaf0d60f9?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=AngelList

UX Designer at Exit Bee

Europe, Remote · Full Time
We started as a SaaS service, we’re evolving into an innovative ad network. Using behavioural analysis and exit intent we’re re-imagining what’s possible in display advertising. We’re working hard to deliver value to our clients and partners. We’re on a mission to deliver the right message to the right user at the right time.Read More

We started as a SaaS service, we’re evolving into an innovative ad network. Using behavioural analysis and exit intent we’re re-imagining what’s possible in display advertising. We’re working hard to deliver value to our clients and partners. We’re on a mission to deliver the right message to the right user at the right time.

Having just completed our 2nd round of funding, we set new goals and aim high. We’re looking for talented, highly motivated people to join our growing team, think outside the box and create something great. Together.

Applied
Apply to Exit Bee
Add a message to Exit Bee
Apply

Job Description

As a UX Designer, you will be designing first-class user experience. You’ll be responsible for deeply understanding our users to design innovative product experiences that solve their problems. As part of the product team, you’ll be working closely with Product Managers and Engineers. We’re re-imagining what’s possible in display advertising so we expect you to come up with new campaign ideas and interactions to maximize campaign performance and ad ROI of our clients.

- Develop go-to-market plans for new product launches and ongoing product adoption initiatives
- Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your design
- Design and deliver wireframes, user journeys, and mockups
- Deliver final specifications and assets to development teams
- Measure UX success and iterating to achieve our business and user goals
- Participate in all phases of a product, from discovery to delivery to iteration
- Understand our client goals and come up with new campaign ideas to reach them
- Manage multiple projects

Skills
User Experience Design, User Interface Design, Agile, HTML5 & CSS3, Product Design
Compensation
£30K–£50K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to Exit Bee
Apply

What We're Building

Exit Bee is the first complete behavioral analysis and exit intent platform. We're on a mission to deliver the right message to the right user at the right time.

With Smart Exit Ads we re-imagine what's possible in display advertising. From image and video ad campaigns to content, contests, lead generation and surveys, Smart Exit Ads maximize our clients' ad ROI. Our campaign viewability is double the viewability of an average banner ad and click-through rates are over 20 times higher.
We offer advertisers a new, premium and high-performing channel to reach their audience on trusted publishers.
We offer publishers a brand new revenue stream by monetizing a "part" of their website that remained unutilized.

With On-Site Retargeting we increase engagement, conversions and sales with tailored campaigns at the right time. Our clients use On-Site Retargeting to optimize their own website traffic by running behavioral, exit intent campaigns On-Site Retargeting is a SaaS product.

items.content:
Freelance Artist-Relations Manager (m/w) // gallereplay

Company: gallereplay

Tags:
  • Video
  • freelance
  • Photo
  • onboarding
  • A&R

    • Who We Are

    gallereplay is an image provider specialising in cinemagraphs – an innovative mix of photo and video perhaps best described as a “living photograph”. Cinemagraphs are eye-catchers and can be used effectively in online marketing and outdoor advertising. Companies can easily license stock cinemagraphs on our platform. We also work with brands to create custom cinemagraphs for their campaigns.

    The Job At Hand

    We’re looking for an A&R to onboard new content creators to our platform. You will be provided with a list of leads (i.e. potential creators) and asked to reach out to them via email. If they signal an interest in joining our platform, you will set up a video call and brief them on our licensing terms and other key points. Once they have registered, you will guide them through the process of submitting their work and having their profile activated on our site. You will be remunerated for every profile activation.

    Remuneration: 30 Euros per profile activation

    Location: Remote

    Starting Date: As soon as possible

    Your Responsibilities

    • Reach out to content creators by email
    • Set up and carry out video calls with content creators
    • Guide them through the submission process

    Requirements

    • Open and friendly personality
    • Strong communicator, especially in English
    • An interest in visual media and cinemagraphs
    • Previous sales, community management or A&R experience are a bonus

    Please apply with a CV, a photo and a few sentences explaining why you wish to work with us. Include “A&R” in the subject line of your email. We look forward to hearing from you!

    Apply for this position

items.content:
Mobile Product Designer

Designer
Anywhere
Company: Buffer
Full Time

Overview

More than 80,000 paying customers depend on Buffer, and we’re grateful to work every day developing intuitive features to make their experience better.

We’re looking for a Mobile Product Designer to help bring new features to our mobile app. With more than 1 million downloads on iOS and Android, our apps have become best-in-class, rating 4.5 stars and up and consistently featured in the Play and App Stores. Our iOS app won a Webby Award for Best Practice in 2018!

We need your help to explore what’s next and how our apps fit into the bigger picture of our multi-product platform. 

FULL-TIME · REMOTE

Buffer is an equal opportunity employer with teammates all around the world. Our team is made up of developers who hail from startups to the theatre – we value diverse and non-traditional backgrounds.

We’re united by Buffer’s , and we celebrate our unique differences. We value creating a diverse and inclusive work environment and are actively working on building a culture where under-indexed groups are truly welcomed and can flourish.

values

What You’ll be Doing:
  • Solving product problems for our two mobile apps: Reply and Buffer, with the support of the mobile product team. We focus on finding the best solutions for our users while they are scheduling, analyzing and replying to social media posts on the go.
  • Designing high-quality interfaces, interactions, and prototypes with a great attention to detail.
  • Working with the mobile engineering team to quickly iterate, collect, understand, and incorporate feedback throughout the design process.
  • Collaborating with product managers and other designers to refine our mobile vision conduct research and hear directly from our customers.
  • As a teammate at Buffer, you will agree to uphold our values and code of conduct.

    Helpful Skills and Experience
    • A solid understanding of the iOS and Android design languages.
    • An online portfolio that shows your recent work.
    •  
      • Previous experience as a product designer, having successfully worked on an end-to-end product improvement or feature.
    •  
      • An understanding of what it means to ship an app and the ability to be involved in the complete process.
    • Passion for the problem-solving process and a willingness to reflect on the future of our mobile application ecosystem.
    • Collaborative spirit and focus on delivering the simplest and best solution for our users.
    • Clear communication skills to work closely with product managers and engineers to find the boundaries of our design problems, see them from multiple perspectives and advocate for the best balance and solutions.

      • What We Value

      Clear communication, , open-mindedness, empathy and patience are just a few of Buffer’s . We are looking for a person who understands this culture and will thrive within a team of people passionate about self-improvement, honesty and openness.  on how we strive to communicate with customers.

      transparencycultural valuesHere’s a guide

      Working at Buffer is collaborative and positive thanks to our core values. We try to be “No Ego Doers” who are aware of our assumptions, and joining us means you’ll work together with the team in order to test and confirm our ideas. In our , we choose to focus on the journey, the growth and evolution that is a career.

      career framework

      Perks and Benefits

      We hope that you’re excited by the possibilities that come with working at Buffer! In addition to our unique culture, we also offer these fun perks and benefits.

      • Technology: Get hooked up with a laptop to do your best work.
      • Learning & development stipend: To encourage our teammates to be their best selves, we offer a small stipend for any course or training they’d like to do.
      • Health insurance: We offer health insurance for all of our team members, international or US based.
      • Salary: Our salary formula adjusts to your cost of living and experience. For this role, the range is $83k – $110k per year.
      • Work remotely: Live and work from wherever you feel happiest.
      • Stock options: Joining the Buffer journey means you can choose to own part of the company.
      • Unlimited time off: Our only policy is that you give yourself a break regularly.
      • Retreats: Join us on annual international company retreats! Our last retreat was in Madrid, Spain.
      • Free books (and Kindle): All you can read, no questions asked.
      • Family Leave: If your family grows during your time at Buffer, we recommend taking 3 months of family leave, regardless of when you joined.

        Where You’ll Work

        Buffer is a fully distributed team, which means that we’re spread across the planet. We have Bufferoos in 15 countries, 11 timezones and 42 cities around the world to build a great culture and product. You’ll work where you’re happiest and most productive, in the place that helps you to become the person you wish to be.

        More about how we work remotely →

        See where the Buffer team is now →

        To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://journey.buffer.com/mobile-product-designer/en →

items.content:
Product Designer (Remote)

Company: Customer.io
Headquarters: Portland, OR
https://customer.io/careers/

Hi, I’m Brian, Director of Product at Customer.io,

I’m looking for a Product Designer to join our team to help craft the future of Customer.io by taking the visual design of our interface to the next level. We want someone who, like us, takes pride in thoughtfully refining the many little design details that in combination produce exceptional usability and confidence for customers. Your strength is in the visual side of UI design—yet with our small nimble team, you’re eager to contribute across a full spectrum of experience design.

At Customer.io, design plays a central role in our product development process. Our product work is done by squads: small autonomous groups of product managers, engineers, and designers like you, focused on solving a customer problem. In addition to working on visual design across our app, you'll be an integral part of a squad focused on specific part of our product, helping to define and design the user experience.

What's Customer.io you may ask? We’re a globally distributed tech startup helping companies talk like people. Our customers are marketers, growth hackers, and engineers who are always dreaming up fresh ideas for how to be sincere and personal in their messages to customers. Unlike typical marketing platforms, we help businesses send meaningful messages based on what people do or don’t do when using a web or mobile app. We give our customers the superpower of sending and tracking phenomenal email, SMSs and push notifications. If you knew that already...amazing. If not, nice to meet you!

Sound like the next step in your career? Read on and apply!

P.S. Identify more as UX Designer? UI Designer? Don’t worry about it - let us know if you think this is the place for you.

As a Designer at Customer.io, you will:

  • Design user interfaces for product features and partner with engineering to get them built.
  • Continually amp up our visual style and UI patterns.
  • Validate your designs directly with customers
  • Assess customer usage patterns and remove roadblocks to successfully completing key tasks.
  • Using both data and customer anecdotes to refine concepts for new features.
  • Explore the latest design trends and promote them with our team


Who you will be collaborating with...

  • Ivana, Sr. UI/UX Designer, to take features from concept to Customer.io! You’ll collaborate continually on distilling user feedback and fellow Amis’ feature pitches into customer goals, wireframes, and visual designs.
  • Madeline, Product Designer, who is working craft our design language across the app by expanding our component library into a full-fledged design system.
  • Brian, Director of Product, to determine what we need to build next for our customers. With Brian you’ll focus a lot on customer problems and outcomes in order to cultivate an iterative design-propelled team culture. Brian recently joined us from Adobe, after spending years building products for designers.
  • 3 front-end engineers with a real passion for design and usability. They’ll be close partners: you’ll laugh together, you’ll cry together, you’ll do the best work of your lives together.


Who are you?

  • You’re an excellent visual designer who enjoys working across the entire UX spectrum. Your heart breaks a little when you see an interface lacking a clear call-to-action or sense of hierarchy. And yes, the one pixel that brings things into alignment matters.
  • Your north star is where simplicity, usability, and style intersect. You’re practiced in listening to customers, trying solutions iteratively, and measuring the results until you reach the solution that stabilizes all three elements.
  • You’re hungry to learn, and you love to understand how things work under the hood. You thrive in technical conversations with engineers when needing to balance constraints with design goals.
  • You’re gutsy and self-directed when it comes to problem-solving and working on multiple projects at once. You’re looking to work with a startup where you’ll be responsible for the impact you make and have a lot of freedom. Working with folks in different time zones will be standard issue for you around here, so being able to stay determined, even when the answers aren’t in front of you, is essential.
  • You are a proactive communicator. You strive to be articulate and empathetic in your interactions and believe in “working out loud” to share work early and helpfully.


What valuable experience and skills will you bring to the table?

  • You have app design experience (you’ve significantly contributed to at least one SaaS or mobile app).
  • You have experience owning UI or UX for features on a product development team.
  • You have directly worked with customers to validate feature interfaces.
  • You’ve successfully partnered with engineers on projects and are confident in engaging on technical topics.


Bonus, but not required (shout about it in your application if you have experience)

  • Marketing Technology and/or SaaS Company experience.
  • Experience prototyping Interactions or UI Animation.


Why should you work with Customer.io?

Work at our head office in Portland, OR or anywhere in the world you want. We want to enable you to do your best work, and this is how we aim to do that:

Salary - We’re offering $90,000-$115,000 USD for this position, with flexibility for location and experience.

Equity - You'll own a piece of the company that you help create. You’ll be recognized for your
contributions by earning equity in the company.

Big Impact - Our team is small, but growing quickly. The work you do will materially impact how successful we are as a company.

Great Tools - Everyone in the company has an Apple computer and is given a budget for a motorized standing desk, Steelcase Leap office chair, external monitor, and anything else you'd like to get your job done.

Health Benefits - We pay 100% of your premiums for you and your family for medical, dental and vision and short and long-term disability.

Paid Parental & Medical Leave - Including adoption.

Retreats - We get our whole company together twice a year. We've had retreats in Barcelona, Romania, Hunter Mountain, Chicago, Iceland, and Portland, Oregon.

Vacation - Rest and recuperation are essential. We offer 4 weeks of paid vacation with flexibility for more.


Diversity statement

At Customer.io, we’re committed to building a diverse environment and encourage minority applicants. So far, we have team members in France, Germany, Canada, Pakistan, India, Australia and all over the US. Our CEO and CTO grew up in Singapore and Arkansas respectively but met in New York City. Our company culture is always evolving; people from different backgrounds bring a valued perspective and thoughtfulness to the work that we do and the culture we foster.

Customer.io provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Customer.io complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Basically, we follow the law, but also like you for who you are!

 

Apply for this position

Come Join Us!Apply via the link below, and make sure you tell us why you’re interested in the position! We’ve added a few questions that will also help us understand how you think.http://bit.ly/2N6JTy9

items.content:
Motion Designer

Worldwide
Company: 90 Degrees West

FULL-TIME

Overview

Do you love great design that’s grounded in concept and then married with motion oh-sooo-smooth? We certainly do, and we want to share our passion with you. Do you want to collaborate with a team of in-house motion designers as well as a global freelance network that delivers expertise across every discipline?

If so – let’s talk. While we won’t put any numbers on experience level, you must have a body of work that bears the fruit of the qualities below.

• Strong design skills — a given!

• Full of passion and initiative

• Self starter with a strong sense of ownership

• Enjoy creative and technical challenges

• Strive for excellence no matter what the job

• Learner who stays curious

• Brings ideas to the table — including storyboards and style frames

• Advanced knowledge of AE, AI & PSD.

• Some C4D Experience – (advanced level is a huge plus)

We would prefer to see your happy face every morning in person, but — hey — it’s 2018, and we’re open to working with you as a full-time remote partner. We believe in being flexible to create a mutually agreeable working arrangement for the right talent. That may even include something like a 9-month gig with summers off. If teachers can do it, why can’t we?

Here is a bit about us. We like to get into projects early to help grow our clients’ concepts. We are team of 17 players who love working in all of these areas: production, editorial, motion graphics, VFX, sound design, music composition and color grading.

We are united by a passion to do great work and have fun doing it. Our clients are primarily agencies that work on national level accounts.

Our compensation is highly competitive. We also provide generous health and retirement benefits. Enough words, let’s look at some pictures.

To allow for creative growth, we strongly believe in giving our artists plenty of free time to create and learn through passion projects. That time, combined with extra love and initiative from the our team, is the catalyst for projects like these.

We’re excited about how motion graphics is expanding into so many new channels and invite you to be a part of it.

 we are offering to the development world. We see it only as the beginning of an interesting intersection of disciplines.

Thanks for considering us! We would love to hear from you.

Email resume and link to online reel to:  

Please format subject line as follows:  Senior Motion Designer – Your Name

items.content:
UI/UX Designer (m/f)

Company: simplabs GmbH
Headquarters: Munich, Germany
https://simplabs.com
We're looking for a UI/UX Designer to join our team. You'll work in a small, international team with responsibility early on and can have a large impact on client as well as open source projects.

We expect you to be able to create appealing visual designs and user experiences as well as implement these designs in HTML and CSS/Sass. You should be experienced with Sketch or other prototyping tools, maintaining design systems for larger projects as well as discussing and teaching those to engineering teams. You should pay attention to detail and ideally have worked self-directed and interacted with clients directly before.

Responsibilities

  • helping clients with their projects as well as supporting our open source projects
  • sensitivity to clients' needs and building trust, reviewing the work of others and discussing UI/UX options in a collaborative fashion
  • sharing your learnings made on client and open-source projects with the community through blog posts
  • participating in open source projects and community; big plus if you like giving talks or would like to start doing it, we'll give you all necessary support in any related engagements

Skills

We expect the following skills:
  • working experience with composing, implementing and maintaining design systems, in particular for web based projects
  • fluency in best practices in UI/UX as well as HTML/CSS
  • collaborating well in a team environment
  • attention to detail
  • basic familiarity with version control systems such as git

If you have experience with any of the following, we'd consider those a bonus (but not require them for a successful application)

  • any experience in product management, including sprint planning in collaboration with a product team / product owners is a plus
  • previous experience with a11y

How we work

We're a team of open-minded developers who value collaboration, empathetic working relationships and well-crafted code. Beyond a supportive team culture and a relaxed work atmosphere in our office in the Munich city center (we're actually right next to the Isar!) for on-site engineers, we enable you to take part in modern projects for clients ranging from small startups to big enterprises, national as well as international. We work closely with our clients and usually join a shared Slack channel with their teams for easy communication. You'll have responsibility early on and have the opportunity to both guide the development of these client projects as well as grow your own technical and interpersonal skill set.

We also offer the opportunity to travel internationally - either to visit clients on-site for a limited time or to attend tech conferences.
We start the day with our standup meeting in which everyone gives an update on what they worked on the previous day and what they plan to do on the current day. Apart from that we're pretty lean and don't have a lot of process. We practice a feature branch based workflow with continuous testing and peer reviews.
Apart from working on client projects we also maintain a variety of open source libraries and tools on which you're invited to work on as well.

What we offer

  • self-guided work on interesting projects for international clients
  • competitive salary
  • 30 days of paid vacation
  • flexible working times to accommodate commitments besides work
  • time to work on open source projects
  • personal support to deepen your knowledge in topics that you feel are close to you
  • chance and support to attend and speak at international conferences
  • a flat organization with little process standing in your way
  • regular company events to meet your team members
  • an international, communicative and supportive team
  • flexible work environment (either on-site in Munich or remote)
  • paid office space for remote engineers in a co-working space or office of your choice
  • the latest MacBook Pro (or the previous one if you don't want the TouchBar) plus an external 4K display

We encourage team members to attend and present at conferences, meetups and other events, providing support and mentoring for presentations. We believe that development of technical and interpersonal skills is important to our team members, and we're therefore committed in providing growth opportunities which include paid time to work on open source projects, attend trainings and participate in mentorships and more.

We strongly believe that diversity of experience contributes to a wider outlook of our team that not only improves our working atmosphere but also increases our productivity as a company. We are committed to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it. We value quality of life, and keep working times flexible to accommodate personal commitments like parenting, sports, hobbies and personal projects.

Apply for this position

If you're interested to learn more about us or apply to this position, send us a message to info@simplabs.com. We're looking forward to samples of your previous work.**Applicants have to be located in Europe**

Why choose VisualCV?

Since launching in 2014, VisualCV has helped over 2 million people make a career move. We are a platform for individuals to create and manage beautiful resumes, portfolios, and personal websites. After launching in June 2014, we have grown exponentially (both in revenue and users), and were recently named #28 on Canada's Fastest Growing Startups list by McLeans Magazine and Canadian Business.

We're a small team who doesn't buy into the typical tech startup hype. We are profitable, growing, and believe in a healthy balance of a great life & great work. We're looking for the right person to join our tight team.

We are hiring a front-end developer / designer with strong grasp of javascript, front-end frameworks and UI/UX design. Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS and JS is a must and if you are familiar with Rails and React.js it’ll be an advantage.

Designer for intellectually honest discourse at Fiskkit

San Francisco, Remote · Contract
Fiskkit is building on online discussion that mechanically favors facts, logic and civility. We turn discussion into structured data, which gives us the ability to *fact-check all online news, in real time* and filter trolling to make comments not just tolerable, but productive and enjoyable.Read More

Fiskkit is building on online discussion that mechanically favors facts, logic and civility. We turn discussion into structured data, which gives us the ability to *fact-check all online news, in real time* and filter trolling to make comments not just tolerable, but productive and enjoyable.

By creating a detailed discussion of each article, Fiskkit can pinpoint strengths and weaknesses of fact, logic and civility. By analyzing reader comments, we provide a "Wikipedia-style" reference page for any article on the net, showing the flaws in any article, line by line.

By putting discussions into structured data, we can also suppress trolling without resorting to censorship. Come ask us how we do all this. Try the public beta at fiskkit.com, and click on the demo video.
Fiskkit is preparing for a roll-out this summer. Stay tuned!!

The Fiskkit team is passionate about creating the best possible place for people to come together and talk about what matters, relying on smart mechanics instead of our better angels to cut through trolling and BS.

If you care about making the world a better place, and are looking for a scrappy startup with the ability to change the relationship between people and information forever, drop us a line.

Applied
Apply to Fiskkit
Add a message to Fiskkit
Apply

Job Description

Fiskkit is looking for a multi-talented visual and UX designer to help us make intellectually honest discussion online as simple and intuitive as possible.

Fiskkit
Fiskkit is a platform for in-line news commenting that "turns discourse into data,"  making the discussion more useful, factual, productive, accountable, civil and enjoyable. Structured data allows us to statistically quality-check all online news in real time, and empower readers to filter trolling without resorting to censorship or moderation. We released a public beta at the Launch Festival in 2015 and were awarded the Social Impact Award by the Grand Jury.

Once you go beyond simple nested commenting online, it requires masterful design to minimize the friction so people can engage with news articles honestly and easily. We are engineering for a system, culture and interface that best promotes facts, logical reasoning and civility online by incorporating the latest social science and usability research.

Fiskkit is bootstrapping to a full launch in 1Q2016, after which we plan to raise funding and grow the team. All positions are full or part-time, with equity based on commitment and experience.

If you want to help build the capacity for people to have more productive and more civil conversations about the issues that really matter, please reach out to us. Fiskkit is a mission-driven venture, but with a very strong business model.

Compensation
$1K–$1K
0.5%–2.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

What We're Building

Fiskkit is an online commenting platform that improves the discussion of news articles by allowing users to tag incorrect facts, bad reasoning or uncivil behavior. It is a place where people can comment on news in depth, and share their opinions through social media.

When multiple people have "fisked" the same article, the system produces a page which highlights the flaws or qualities in the text, as determined by a statistical test of significance of the (human-input) tags. In short, it has the potential to fact-check all online news/content in real time.

Additionally, by allowing users to fisk each other's comments, we create a granular, peer-reviewed discussion of the topic which is much more useful - and useable - for interested readers. This allows us to build in a Troll Filter which will enable readers to weed out bad-faith commentary, while preserving Fiskkit's "No Censorship" principle.

It's the future of online engagement.

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=7}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer

Full-time
Portland
Remote job
Mid-sized business
Posted Aug 15 – Accepting applications

About SurveyMonkey

Founded in 1999 and based in San Mateo, California, SurveyMonkey is the world’s leading platform for turning people’s voices and opinions into actionable data — People Powered Data. Whether it’s with customers, employees, or a target market, SurveyMonkey helps curious individuals and companies — including 99% of the Fortune 500 — have conversations at scale with the people who matter most. It’s People Powered Data that allows them to understand not only “what” is happening, but “why.” SurveyMonkey’s 700+ employees throughout North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific are dedicated to powering the curious.

 

About SurveyMonkey Business Solutions

SurveyMonkey is the world’s most popular survey platform. While it is a great general-purpose tool used by millions, there is ample opportunity for more specialized solutions. That’s where we come in. We build standalone, targeted SaaS products that bring great UX to solving more specific business problems.

To date, our 12-person team has shipped three products:

  • SurveyMonkey CX - Measure and improve customer satisfaction
  • SurveyMonkey Engage - Understand and foster employee engagement
  • TechValidate - Source and publish 3rd-party verified customer proof

We’re on a mission to bring better design to the business world, and while we’re at it we’d like to make our mark with stunning data viz, personable interfaces, and a commitment to empathizing with our users.

 

Who We’re Looking For

We’re looking for a talented designer with demonstrable experience working on user-friendly SaaS applications. Your portfolio should demonstrate the ability to design for all screen sizes from mobile to desktop. You should also be comfortable writing clear, concise UI copy.

Strong visual design, product design, usability, and communication skills are essential. Technical skills such as CSS, Javascript, and familiarity with Ruby on Rails are also a strong plus, though not required. Experience contributing to a central design system is a major plus and you will have opportunity to participate as we evolve ours.

If you’re jazzed about making really complex things super simple we should talk. If you’re interested in creating the future of intuitive data visualization (and have an opinion on what that means) we should talk. If you believe that great design belongs everywhere and have the mettle to make it happen, we should definitely talk.

 

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience on a product design team working across the entire product development lifecycle and successfully shipping products.
  • Experience working effectively with cross-functional teams including shepherding designs through the development process.
  • Experience collaborating with other designers to create a cohesive cross-product experience, both leveraging and contributing to a centralized design system.
  • Solid user-centered design fundamentals with information architecture, interaction design and visual design skills and the ability to quickly produce high quality deliverables across the range of disciplines.
  • Demonstrated ability to write clear, effective UI copy.
  • Ability to present design solutions at all levels of the organization with clear, articulate rationale.
  • Proficient with Sketch, Invision, Creative Suite, and knowledgeable about HTML, CSS, modern browser technologies, and cross-device design.
  • Portfolio showcasing examples of product design work.

 

Why Work Here?

We are a remote team. As long as your work day overlaps the Pacific timezone by at least four hours, where you live and work and up to you. We’re not strangers though — in addition to a sane amount of video calls, we meet up quarterly to get to know each other better and have some fun. In the past year, we’ve been bowling in Phoenix, made sushi in San Francisco, and toured a brewery.

We are strong believers in work-life balance. We know world class work can be done in just forty hours a week when distractions are minimized and the pace is sustainable. As such, you will be expected to be a manager of one.

Naturally, we offer competitive salaries and annual bonuses, medical/dental benefits, generous PTO, 401k, paid holidays, and meaningful equity compensation. We also supply you with top of the line equipment for your home office.

Finally, in a world of clunky “enterprise” software, we consider great UX and visual design to be a strategic advantage, and we need you to help us keep improving. Our track record gives our team a lot of autonomy — this is your chance to rethink how “business solutions” should look and function, and to have fun while doing it.

Join us.

 

At SurveyMonkey, we offer competitive salaries, medical/dental benefits, PTO, 401k, paid holidays and parental leave, and equity compensation.

SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
UI/UX Designer

USA

full-time

Autosoft, Inc. (www.autosoftdms.com) is a Dealership Management System (DMS) software company serving the retail automotive industry for 30 years. At Autosoft, we embrace change, encourage out of the box thinking, and listen to our employees to help shape the future of our business.

We currently have an opening for an UI/UX Designer that will work with cross-functional teams to develop designs for SaaS applications.

Who You Are:

As an UI/UX Designer, you will be responsible for creating intuitive, visually appealing and effective designs for Autosoft products across PC, tablet, and mobile platforms, working with both product development and marketing.

What You’ll Do:

*Develop, communicate, and implement user experience vision and UI framework for features across desktop, IOS and Android applications for current and next generation products

*Collaborate cross-functionally with product management, development and marketing to take features from concept to launch

*Document design solutions using sketches, wireframes, flows, and pixel-perfect mocks

*Deliver detailed designs and components to agile development teams and refine as necessary during product sprints

*Maintaining vision and understanding of UI/UX trends in the ever-changing SaaS environment

*Prototype designs as needed for user research and tests

*Create and maintain style guides and UI pattern libraries

What You’ll Need:

*Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Interaction Design, or related field

*Minimum three (3) years of experience in software UI/UX or web design

*Demonstrated success working with Creative and/or Marketing leads to establish and execute on program vision

*Expertise in wireframing and visual design tools such as Axure, Adobe XD, Photoshop, Illustrator, is expected.

*Strong visual design sense, clean command over typography, interaction design, and usability

*Knowledge of HTML, JavaScript and CSS

*Well versed in fundamental visual and interactive design disciplines and principles

*Experience with responsive design methods and development of design iterations

*Deep understanding of user-centered design methodologies

*Ability to visualize, own, and execute the creation of an experience from initial concept to implementation

Apply for this Job

items.title: UI/UX Specialist / Creative Coder
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=5, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=33}
items.content:
UI/UX Specialist / Creative Coder

Berlin

full-time

Do you have the drive to create something new? Do you want to be the engine for new ideas and innovations, drive plans and projects and put them on the road? Do you want to work in a small team and take advantage of the start-up atmosphere at a premium automobile manufacturer with a creative and self-structured environment in Berlin? Then join us!

For our newly founded interdisciplinary company MBition GmbH, we are looking for an enthusiastic UI/UX Specialist with a pioneering spirit who wants to help shape the future of mobility. Your duties will involve helping to build the visual and user interaction for the next generation of mobility solutions. What does this mean? You will be able to help design and see implemented the very products you are working on. In a pure research and development capacity. Very few start ups in Europe can offer that. If this sounds interesting? Please come join us!

Responsibilities

  • Strategic, creative and innovative think tank for new concept developments with a forward-looking vision
  • Creation and validation of rough and fine usability concepts for HMIs within the car (headunit, instrument cluster, HUD, SDS) and outside the car (mobile, web)
  • Define and establish information architectures and UI widget elements
  • Planning and execution of user customer studies for concept validation
  • Prototype implementation of interaction concepts through programming
  • Interdisciplinary collaboration with Daimler AG’s development locations
  • Coordinate with internal and external development partners

Profile

  • Degree and professional experience in UI/UX design, media informatics or a similar field with a technical focus on the UI/UX creation process
  • Experience in creation of scribbles, wireframes, flow charts, screen mockups, interactive prototypes through programming
  • Sense for UI design and intuitive user interfaces
  • Knowledge of 3D-visualization, augmented reality and multimodal interactions (e.g. gaze- & gesture interactions) desirable
  • Experience in agile project management (Scrum)

Experience

  • Excellent knowledge of creative tools, such as Sketch, Invision, Adobe Creative Suite and of tools for interactive prototypes, such as Flinto, Unity
  • Programming skills in modern web technologies like HTML5, CSS, Angular, React, TypeScript, JQuery to create platform-independent, long-living interactive prototypes
  • Experience with tools that support agile development processes (e.g. Jira, Confluence)
  • High level of motivation and ability to adapt to change
  • Ability to compromise and perseverance
  • Creativity, highly developed conceptual skills
  • Awareness of trends and new technologies and the opportunities they present for the mobility of the future
  • Intercultural skills
  • Fluent in English, German is a plus
  • Willingness to travel

Interested?

We look forward to receiving your complete application, including CV (in English or German) and relevant references with the following information:

  • Job title and reference number
  • Salary expectation
  • Earliest start date

Technical Coach (Design)

Company: Thinkful Inc.

Technical Coach (Design) 
 Remote · Part Time or Full Time


Founded in 2012, Bloc was the first online coding bootcamp. Today, Bloc offers aspiring career-changers programs in software development and design. Bloc offers you an opportunity to join a tight-knit team pursuing a worthy goal: the training, guidance, and support of those who are working towards to new careers as developers and designers. Job Description 
Bloc’s mission is to help individuals pursue their craft and improve their lives. As a Technical Coach at Bloc, you will directly help students develop mastery and support them on their journey to become software developers and designers by helping them solve their day-to-day problems and questions. Responsibilities

  • Respond to technical questions and guidance requests that come to the Technical Coaching team
  • Adhere to the established Service-Level Agreement to ensure students are receiving responses in the defined timely manner
  • Maintain the required quality in assisting students with technical questions and guidance
  • Adhere to processes implement by the Technical Coaching team 
  • Provide strategic feedback to the Technical Coaching Lead to improve the experience for students and optimize the processes of the team
  • Ensure communication with students and others always exemplifies Bloc’s core values
  • As necessary, work with Grading Team Lead and other Grading Team Members
  • As necessary, interact with mentors, Student Success, or students ad-hoc

Requirements

  • Must have at least 6 months of professional industry experience OR have completed one of Bloc’s Developer Track programs OR have completed Bloc's Design Track Program successfully
  • Must have significant industry-level experience with: front-end web technologies (HTML/CSS/Javascript/Git) and UX/UI Design or User Research using one of the following tools: Sketch, InVision, Figma 
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Patient and empathetic
  • High level of detail orientation and an exceptional work ethic 
  • Must thrive working autonomously 
  • Genuinely excited about helping students who are taking charge of their own education and striving for better careers
  • Developed sense of empathy and understanding (Learning can be a challenge!)
  • Must be coachable and adaptable to a fast-paced work environment
  • Must have a reliable, high-speed Internet connection
  • Eligible to work in the United States (Bloc does not currently sponsor visas)
  • Must reside in one of the following states: Alabama, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, New Hampshire, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin



Terms of Employment

  • This role will last for a period of 3 months; continuation depends on performance and mutual interest.
  • Remote .
  • Flexible full-time or part-time roles available, with the option to work evenings and weekends when Bloc students are active.  10 hours per week minimum.
  • Full-time roles are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits.
