items.title: Autodidactic I: Inventor + Creator + Artist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=6, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Inventor + Creator + Artist

Company: Autodidactic I
Headquarters: New York, NY

Imagine a fully self-sustaining company with no customers, products, or employees, a company that will grow and generate profit year after year completely on its own with no work done anywhere by any human being. Such a company already exists. Autodidactic I is a self-sustaining, autonomous company - where all revenue generation is automated by a fully autonomous AI and the humans can focus solely on creative endeavors. The company's vision is to create effectively a creators guild, an environment where pure, unrestrained creativity can thrive without the taint of profit motive or outside pressure - a concept they call the "Autodidactic Islands."
The current team consists of primarily self-taught individuals each deeply skilled in multiple fields and disciplines. As such, we are constantly looking for others like ourselves who are equally inventors, creators, and artists at heart to join us in the vision behind the company. We believe the kind of projects we take on require the curiosity, hunger, and worldliness that only come from being genuinely interested in both programming and finance, math and literature, art and science, polymath and autodidact. This is a company built to do anything by people who do everything.

*Please do not apply if you only have interest and experience in one field.*At a minimal, you have a solid foothold in each the *financial*(algorithmic trading, blockchain, autonomous hedge funds, etc), *technical*(coding, virtual reality, artificial intelligence, etc), and *artistic*(film, music, games, etc). A typical day can go from trading cryptocurrencies and building AIs to acting an impromptu skit and composing soundtracks by ear. There is no room to dabble or tag along. We are not looking for "masters of none." This is not an entry level position and not a specialized role. This is not an artist support group and not an accelerator or incubator to seed ideas. We are not here to save anyone, nor are we interested in anyone wanting to save the world. This is a team for those crazy and curious enough to build rockets to Mars or fuse with AI for immortality. This is a ship for those wanting to see how far they can go and not just how long they can survive. We've built an engine that lets us tackle any project we can think of, pursue any idea we can dream of, and we’re looking for others who can take it even further, others who, like us, have a strong sense of adventure, a healthy level of insanity, and a genuine desire to take over the world... just because we can! Bahaha!
Learn more about what we're up to at https://www.autodidactic.ai
As a way to filter many who will probably apply without reading what the role entails, please reach out to us directly at apply [ at ] autodidactic.ai rather than just hit the apply button. Note the team is spread across the world and frequently travels. Be prepared to be in a different city almost every other week (not a joke). There is no salary, but you will literally become part owner with control of the company.

Apply for this position

Join Us: apply@autodidactic.ai

items.title: UX Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
We’re looking for an early career user-centred UX Designer to join a fast growing fintech startup.

At PassFort, we share a powerful vision to enable businesses & individuals to establish trust online. We currently do this by giving regulated businesses the tools they need to automate and digitalise the onboarding, verification and management of their customers - that means customers can be onboarded in real-time, without ever having met in person.

And this is just the beginning - our technology allows us to define what ‘trust’ means across the digital economy. Our long term aim is to create a single network where people and businesses can share their digital identity securely and interchangeably - whether they’re applying for a mortgage, listing on the stock market, or applying for a new job. We're transforming how trust is established online, in the same way that Salesforce transformed sales, Stripe transformed payments and AWS transformed DevOps.

What you’ll be doing

You’ll work with our Lead Designer to help solve complex user-software problems. You’ll be a voice for our users and their needs. An internal champion for exceptional product quality and the need for cohesive experiences.

On a day-to-day basis you’ll be involved in all parts of the design process. You’ll take part in user research, uncovering and documenting under served user needs. You’ll go wide in looking for solutions to user problems, generating multiple low-fidelity potential solutions.

Using your inclusive, open and transparent approach to work, you’ll seek out feedback from users, designers, product managers and engineers throughout the design process, receiving in good faith and using new insights to inform the direction of your work.

Your solutions will be simple and elegant and make use of the PassFort design system which you will help to maintain and extend when necessary.

We see this as a development role, and if you’re driven and motivated to learn and take on more responsibility, the opportunity will be here!

What we’re looking for

Strong interaction design skills: You’ll have an understanding of multi-step and cross-platform flows. Proficiency in sketching and wireframing simple features and user journeys, and an understanding for the need to design for different potential states (errors, successes, dead-ends).
Understanding of how user research fits into the design process: You’ll be aware of different methodologies and when to use them.
Understanding of visual design fundamentals: layout, visual hierarchy, colour, typography, and iconography.
Desire to continually learn, develop your skills and evolve as a designer and have the confidence and maturity to experiment with new research and design approaches as well as new methods and tooling.
Ability to be comfortable with, and embrace ambiguity.
Working knowledge of Sketch.
A portfolio showing your process and decision-making skills, as well as the final deliverables.

The Perks!
Equity! We want you to succeed as we do
Great location - we’re central to three stations, and sandwiched between Brick Lane and Spitalfields market
An annual learning & development budget to spend on professional or personal development, we’re invested in both
Birthday off - relax and put your feet up
Dental cover
Access to Perkbox - discounts to services and products (and honestly it’s fantastic)
Equally Enhanced Maternity/Paternity/Shared Leave pay
Generous holiday entitlement
Pension contributions - investing in your future is important
Pick your own equipment and kit
Biscuits… we’re a bit obsessed. We have a weekly ‘guest’ biscuit to broaden your biscuit horizons.

items.content:
Tigerspike is one of the largest specialised enterprise mobility companies in the world that solves complex business problems by creating mobile and digital products, which improve people’s lives.

We are looking for a UX Designer with commercial experience, who is eager to learn and wants to work on a variety of projects, to join us.

You'll learn the Tigerspike XD methodology, grow your skills, knowledge and experience across a diverse range of industries, creating best in class digital products.

*The Role*
We’re looking for thinkers, problem solvers and lovers of all things design to join our rapidly growing team.

You will work closely with our highly experienced designers and have ample opportunity to watch, listen and learn and from them. You will follow their lead whilst they teach and mentor you to help execute on their strategy and be instrumental in getting deliverables to the finish line.

As a UX Designer, your primary tool at Tigerspike will be your empathy with users, thinking power and understanding of human behaviour and psychology.

You will be a part of a cross-functional team; assisting in user research activities, conceptualising solutions based on research insights and creating task flows and wireframes.

*You'll like working with us if you:*

*Love solving problems

*Thrive in a fast-paced, but highly collaborative environment

*Like the flexibility of working from home/ from a coffee shop at times

*Want to work for a global company and have the opportunity to work in one of our other offices (e.g Sydney, Singapore, Dubai)

*Like having free lunch and drinks every Friday

*Fancy free Bootcamp or Yoga class every week

*Want to enjoy 25 days holidays per year (on top of public holidays)

*Would like having a £60 monthly mobile phone allowance

*Value learning new skills through personal and professional training allowance

*This job might be for you if you:*

*Have some professional work experience as a UX Designer

*Can inspire clients and turn ideas into world-class experiences

*Have the innate ability to empathise with people and appreciate their context, culture and habits

*Can work around and find creative solutions within constraints

*Are comfortable following direction, but have self-motivation to use your initiative

*Have experience designing for small screens as well as big screens

*Can effectively communicate solution ideas to stakeholders as well as team members

*Have an understanding of & appreciation for the context, medium & platforms you’re designing for

*Even more awesome if you have:*

*Professional work experience in a similar environment
*Knowledge of User Centered Design principles
*Experience gathering requirements through workshops, interviews and research

*More About Us*
Tigerspike is a digital products company improving people’s lives through technology. Focusing on strategy, experience design, development and systems integration, our work is hinged on five key values: Transparency, Resilience, Problem-solving, Energy and Curiosity. We have a reputation for innovation and creating long-term partnerships with customers such as Emirates, American Express, The United Nations, Westfield, ADP and New Look.

Our People are our culture and that is what makes us unique. Founded in 2003 with a team spanning 10 global offices and counting, we are excited to continue supporting businesses #TheTigerspikeWay.



_We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status._

items.content:
Role Summary

This role presents an incredible opportunity for someone to really make their mark on our product and company as we continue to go through a high growth phase.

We’re looking for a talented designer to lead on our user interface design, and work closely with our Product Manager in developing an overall delightful user experience. The role is multi-disciplined with a focus on user interface but the opportunity to influence overall product strategy and experience.

The project is a rare opportunity to work on designing a completely new experience for a well-established and understood user base of major accountants and larger internal finance teams.

You'll be reporting directly to our Product Manager. Our head office is located in Moorgate London; however, we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

Responsibilities

* You will be the driving force behind user interface design at Chaser
* You will be working directly with our Product Manager to understand users and create delightful user experiences
* Developing wireframes, high-fidelity prototypes and conducting user tests
* Leading on Chaser’s design systems and workflows
* Working closely with our engineering team in the implementation and testing of designs
* Influencing product strategy and vision
* Pitching in, getting your hands dirty, and doing whatever it takes to help Chaser grow!

About You

* You have at least two years experience working in a product design related role
* You are someone who thrives on uncertainty. You won’t necessarily have worked in a startup environment before, but you will be drawn by the incredible opportunities for learning and growth that it presents.
* You are excited to work autonomously and take initiative on projects, but you understand the importance of keeping key stakeholders involved
* You have a proven ability to produce wireframes, prototypes and high-quality user interfaces
* You are someone who sets very high standards for others and especially for yourself. You believe strongly in the importance of Do What You Say You Will Do.
* You are excited about best practices for design and emerging trends and tools
* You are an excellent written and verbal communicator

Benefits

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

items.content:
Inspiral is a venture-backed company that empowers people around the world to share knowledge and skills instantly. Become a cook, fix appliances, assemble furniture - learn any task in seconds. Instant knowledge. Practical science fiction.

We are a unique founding team featuring a unicorn founder, a growth hacker, and a technology wizard. As a cherry on top, we are lucky to be joined by an incredible advisory board and support network featuring some of London’s top entrepreneurs.

With our platform, we are looking to reshape the user behavior of a generation, which is why we are looking for a genius UX/UI Designer to join our small team and help shape the future of instant education.

For this role we ideally look for:
* Passion for tech-for-good products and building something meaningful
* User-centric, feedback-driven, iterative approach to problem-solving
* Experience designing mobile and web applications
* Ability to deliver designs which can be easily translated into code

Nice to have’s:

In your application please include:

We love people with experience. But even more, we love people who love our open culture and working together as a team. We are looking for ambitious self-starters with a growth mindset who are enthusiastic about our mission and think on a truly global scale.

You will be working directly together with the co-founding team featuring one of Europe’s top tech entrepreneurs. If you love creating the future of instant education as much as we do - apply now and let’s grab a coffee!

Skills:
Mobile Application Design, Rapid Prototyping, UI/UX Design, Logo and Branding Design

items.title: Hireology: UX Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
UX Designer

Full-time
Anywhere
Remote job
Mid-sized business
Posted Jul 27 – Accepting applications

Hireology’s technology empowers businesses to build great teams.  Over the last seven years, we’ve grown from a startup to a market-leading organization with over 150 team members, and built an award-winning culture that makes this company an amazing place to work.

It’s with that in mind that Hireology is looking to add a UX Designer to our User Experience team.

As part of our UX team, you would be joining a small but passionate group of individuals who work daily to improve our user’s experience. We work with Product to help scope, design, and test new features and interfaces. We work with Engineering to help breathe life into those interfaces and bring them to our users. We work with Customer Success to understand and address existing pain points.

You’ll be tasked with understanding use cases, exploring innovative UI solutions, and identifying usability problems. Throughout the design process, you’ll create and communicate UX flows, develop mockups, and contribute to user personas. You’ll design clean, modern interfaces across different browsers and devices using the latest responsive methods. During all of this, you’ll participate in user testing sessions, continuing to refine the experience for our users.

Hireology is based in Chicago, but our Engineering and UX teams work remotely, so you’ll have the option of working from the comfort of your home or right in our office if you’re local. Compensation is competitive, and we offer a full benefits package. We have regular company-wide events, semi-annual team gatherings, and frequent celebrations when we hit our goals.

As one of our UX Designers, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Developing sketches, diagrams, and designs.
  • Collaborating with engineers, product managers, and users to deliver amazing experiences
  • Working closely with our Product Managers to solve business problems.
  • Advocating, designing, and planning qualitative and quantitative design experiments for our products
  • Being a user-advocate during the entire development process

So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? We have a pretty unique culture here at Hireology, and the person who will be successful in this role:

  • Considers User Experience as more than just aesthetics
  • Constantly searches for simplicity
  • Loves constructive criticism
  • Is obsessed with understanding the way people “work” and think
  • Is comfortable doing user research and intelligently integrating findings into your work
  • Has the ability to distill key issues from usability tests and implement practical solutions
  • Has the flexibility and agility to iterate or change design direction based on external feedback
  • Has a passion for design and great user experience
  • Works well both in a collaborative team environment and independently
  • Is a lifelong learner with a continuous eye for improving craft
  • Is a highly motivated self-starter with a positive attitude

Okay, we’ve laid out what the job is - now are you qualified? Below are the minimum qualifications we’re looking for in a UX Designer. Also, we want a chance to get to know who you are and why you applied, so please include a cover letter.

  • Three to six years of user experience or product design experience.
  • Experience designing complex web applications.
  • Strong knowledge of user experience design, information architecture, interaction design, and website development methodology.
  • Familiar with conducting user research.
  • A working understanding of personas, journey maps, and usability testing.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States.

So what can you expect after you apply? You will:

  • Take a brief true/false survey. Be sure to check your email after you apply.
  • Have a phone conversation with someone on our UX team. This is a high level conversation about you, but also a good opportunity for you to learn more about us.
  • Meet with our other UX Designers to talk shop. Be prepared to talk about how you approach work technically with examples of how you have done it in the past. No homework or on-the-spot assignments. We just want to nerd out a bit with you.
  • Go over your career history with our Senior Manager of UX. This will be an opportunity for us to get an idea of how you got to where you are, and if where you want to go lines up with where we are going.
  • Meet virtually with some more of the remote team. We want to give you some idea of the people you will be working with. We ask the serious questions here, like your top three movies.
  • Provide us some references. We use our automated reference check system for this, so you just give us some names, they fill out a survey, and we are all set.
  • Speak with a member of our leadership team. If you have made it this far, just be yourself, and everything will be fine.

items.content:
Amplify Life is a personal challenge and coaching hub, recently available on the App Store and Google Play.

We are looking for a Junior UI Designer to join our dynamic team based in a unique location on the outskirts of Horsham. With stunning countryside views, a team who are full of life and a quickly evolving brand, Amplify Life is truly an exceptional place to work.

Reporting into the CMO you will work closely with the UX lead and senior designer who will prioritise day to day projects and tasks. You will use your creative flair to develop exciting App design to engage our users.
Our ideal candidate is an enthusiastic and imaginative individual who is keen to progress their skills and offer valuable creative insight. If you can pick up on trends and embrace best practice on user experience then we would love to hear from you.

Responsibilities include:
• Design pages and screens for web and native app projects
• Produce assets required for websites and apps (player images, logos etc)
• Create infographics and visuals for use by clients across social media
• Support the wider creative team across all Pulselive projects
• Support on the creation of marketing & business development material
What we are looking for:
• Skilled in the use of Sketch, Photoshop & Invision. Competent with Illustrator and InDesign a bonus
• A creative flair, demonstrating excellent eye for detail
• Some experience in UI/UX and modern digital design disciplines
• An understanding and passion for emerging trends
• Ability to prioritise and manage multiple projects across multiple clients at the same time
• Positive, hard working, personable individual with a hunger to learn more
• Interest in getting people healthier and happier

We don’t expect you’ll be the finished article but we are looking for someone who has lots of potential, a desire to progress and basic skills in the above packages.

Amplify can offer a competitive salary and benefits as well as 25 days holiday (excluding bank holidays). Our offices offer a stunning and peaceful setting to work in, a fully stocked soft drinks fridge, BBQ facilities, sun terrace, table tennis table, football and badminton facilities and a woodland adventure trail.

Due to remote location access to a car is a must!

items.title: UX/UI Designer
items.content:
UX/UI Designer

Location: Remote Moscow
Role and job type: Design / Product Full-time

Job Description

Akropolis is looking for a designer to join our growing team to create exciting design work to be used for our blockchain platform and our media channels. This position requires a high level of creativity, as well as the ability to use data-driven insights and other team member inputs to produce relevant material.

Akropolis has grown rapidly over the past few months and we are looking for someone to take charge of our design operations and help us expand our digital footprint. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in producing various designs which promote user engagement.

Daily Operations:

  • Design graphics content for different social media platforms.
  • Designing interfaces for web/mobile apps;
  • Create visuals for marketing material and other media.
  • Graphic design and visual style-related tasks;
  • Creation of methodologies and specifications for usability testing;
  • Prototyping;
  • Prepare charts and infographics for Akropolis material.
  • Optimize website design: page mapping, active elements design etc
  • Working with marketing and technical team.

Previous experience/skills:

  • Knowledge of the principles of web/mobile app usability;
  • Knowledge of the principles of creating/drawing functional sketches, graphics etc.;
  • Ability to work comfortably with the necessary graphics software;
  • Understanding of usability testing principles, creation of testing methodologies, results analysis;
  • Project development experience and a deep insight into user interfaces based on a variety of platforms;
  • Ability to argue one’s case and visualise ideas;
  • Fluent spoken and written English;
  • Working with legacy: ability to maintain the consistency with works of previous designers;
  • Experience working with startups, preferably in the Crypto space;
  • Project development experience and a deep insight into user interfaces based on a variety of platforms.

What we offer:

  • Working with an international team of world-class professionals with experience in finance, pension, blockchain and crypto industries;
  • A fulfilling, challenging and flexible work experience;
  • Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • You can work remotely or from our office in Moscow;
  • Practically unlimited professional and career growth opportunities.

Salary range

Competitive
